website_summaries.verdict: The Kinvara 7 from Saucony is a running shoe that provides adequate service to those who want a comfortable running experience. It can handle up-tempo running and daily training, which are great activities for beginners and advanced athletes. Based on the reviews, the Kinvara 7 has been positively accepted by the users.
pros: Based on some reviews, the Kinvara 7 has a breathable and comfortable upper coverage
The welded thin-film overlays called the Flex Film secures the foot in a snug fit
Runners generally welcomed the moisture-wicking qualities of the RUNDRY Collar Lining
The SSL EVA is a midsole component that’s durable, lightweight and responsive
The EVERUN Heel Insert assists in returning energy to the wearer during heel striking
The outsole was durable enough for road running, according to user reviews
The Saucony Kinvara 7 is available in 7 different color options
cons: Some runners felt that it was a bit tight in the midfoot area
Others experienced the sole unit remain inflexible even after wearing it a few times
The testers said that the midsole wasn’t as comfortable as the previous version

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Grid Cohesions for years. I just switched to the Kinvara 7s and found them not quite as supportive as I expected from a shoe that is touted as one of the best for plantar fasciitis sufferers, but they are comfortable nonetheless. Compared to the Grid Cohesions and numerous other popular running shoes, they are extremely light, balanced in the sole, and just enough wider in the toe box to allow for a comfortable spread and natural footfall. Little to no break-in time doesn't hurt either. All in all, I'm pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron L Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by low weight yet good support of Kinvara 7
customer_reviews.text: I really like the comfort and weight of the kinvara 7. It felt like I was putting on gloves rather than running shoes. I did buy them a half-size larger than my usual 9.5 US size since they run slightly smaller. Despite their lightness, I felt my high arches were well supported and didn't have any flare-up of plantar fasciitis, which can occur if I use shoes with too little arch support. What remains to be seen is whether they hold up well with my weight over 170 lbs. I still expect to use my Saucony Guide 10s for longer training runs over 13 miles, but will definitely consider using these for my next half-marathon.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Nafziger

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the previous versions (for me).
customer_reviews.text: First of all, let me say that every foot is different, so what works for me may not work for you. But I have been running in Kinvaras since the Kinvara 2, and FOR ME this version is not as comfortable as the Kinvara 5 or the Kinvara 6. My feet hurt when wearing these shoes on runs over 10 miles. So for the shorter runs, they're fine, but I don't like the reconstruction of the sole when compared to its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight, comfortable sneaker. Usually wear a wide, went with other reviews stating it ran looser. Fit is great. Hopefully the construction will hold up better than other Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Otis_Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Treadmill shoe!
customer_reviews.text: 4th pair, so I have no issues. They continue to impress. This is my second pair of 7s. Fit is loose above the midfoot and hugs the sole well to the foot and especially the heel. Consistent and perfect for long repetitive runs (treadmill, track, paved).
customer_reviews.author: anWingate

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻 great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair of shoes for my husband who loves running half marathons. He has a lot of different kinds, colors and brands of running shoes but this so far he told me is his favorite.He said that during and after his run, his legs felt great.No discomforts.According to him, it's lightweight, has sleek design, flexible soles and mostly, he loved the color I chose for him.I would buy him another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sig

customer_reviews.title: Tighter, less cushioned Kinvara
customer_reviews.text: Not as wide as previous versions. Lost some cushion, too. Where did it go? It went away when the outsole lugs were replaced by the chevron pattern outsole. Those lugs provided some more cushion and more grip as well making those Kinvaras a little more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: James Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: Go Run
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Saucony. I was a devoted Asic gel fan but these running shoes out perform them in comfort and durability. They do run a bit narrow but I like the heal support and the wider toe allows for toe splay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly snug on sides, but great, forward leaning support in a light shoe
customer_reviews.text: After one run, it seems that the shoes are a snug fit on the sides (though the side material is quite flexible), but fit as expected at the toe. Great support throughout the run, design almost feels like the shoes are doing the running for you. This is likely due to the thicker heal support compared to my previous Kinvara 4s. Good support that somehow manages to still feel light. Good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Akers

customer_reviews.title: so far over 200 miles and everything is good, no pain or blisters when running in these ...
customer_reviews.text: Still using these pair of shoes, I believe they a little lighter than Saucony Kinvara 6's but I have owned 3 pair of 6's and ran over 500 miles in each. Hopefully will do the same in these, so far over 200 miles and everything is good, no pain or blisters when running in these pair. I purchased 11 and usually wear 10 in casual everyday shoes, but feet tend to swell when I run.
customer_reviews.author: Sergei

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite running shoes. It's the shoe that qualified me for the Boston Marathon. The shoe can go the distance with comfort and support. It's very comfortable and supportive to the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Weinbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe and Not Only because they Come in Seahawks Colors!
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is my go to running shoe. I've owned shoes from the Kinvara series since version 5. I've liked them all. Light with minimal cushioning. Just how I like it. I've run 5ks, marathons, and all distanced between in Kinvara series shoes. The only drawback is that they show their wear quick and need to be swapped out at about 300 miles or so.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe. I bought these because I run with ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe. I bought these because I run with minimalist shoes for shorter runs 3 miles or less, but wanted a cushioned shoe for longer asphalt runs. The cushioning is deep and soft, they are very light, and they are very comfortable on longer runs. I wear 9.5 dress shoe and 10 sneaker, these fit me well in 10.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Narrow in toe box
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it and up size 1/2 size. That shoe is a bit big, but still a great shoe. If the toe box on this was a bit bigger then this would be my main marathon shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Running on a cloud!
customer_reviews.text: I've run two half marathons in these shoes and they are amazing! Conform perfectly to my feet, are incredibly light, have perfect support, and wear out very slowly considering the soft materials. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: CMarchand

customer_reviews.title: Great Saucony runners
customer_reviews.text: Great Saucony sneakers. I have had a chance to put a few miles on this now and i have to say that they are extremely comfortable. I have run for many years with Saucony sneakers and these are yet another great pair. Really light and have good absorbing cushioning soles and a nice form fitting upper.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, seems to hold up fine
customer_reviews.text: I use these as my marathon training shoes and this is the second pair I have owned (after switching from another brand of shoe since they stopped making it). Great shoe, seems to hold up fine, last pair I had about 500 miles on them and they were dirty but otherwise in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Warren

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Mesh at toe tip rips. Not even used for training. Desk job. I wear hurricanes mostly and iso 3 seem to have fixed this. Prior hurricanes did the same
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are nice and seem comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are nice and seem comfortable. Good for running or working in an emergency department when on my feet for long hours. However this particular style was a bit small. So I recommend going 0.5 to 1 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Tysonshamrock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I run about 16 miles a week. These are some of the most comfortable shoes I've worn running. I used to wear the under armor ones that were similar to these, however, they were not as reliable and wore out in about 2 months. I've only had these for about 3 weeks now, and I cannot complain!
customer_reviews.author: ActivelyEngagedinLife

customer_reviews.title: Best Saucony shoe yet!
customer_reviews.text: What a great shoe! I've had Saucony shoes for about five years and this pair is the best so far. They fit great, are very light, and are really comfortable. Plus, the colors and designs are one of a kind! I don't run in them, but my job requires me to be on my feet all day, and these shoes are great for that very thing!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Vezzani

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I buy, because the first one was big. I liked how it fits, it's my first time to wear Saucony. I am willing to share my experience later also
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Ahmed Yateem

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and gives good arch support
customer_reviews.text: Overall the shoe seems ok! Lightweight and gives good arch support. The problem is the shoe rubs my small toe on both feet. I thought after a few days of breaking in my feet would adjust. They haven’t. Going to see if my son will want them and I will order some ASICS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The everun foam is a nice transition. 4MM heel to toe is not real ...
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a few years of minimalist shoes, including toe shoes. Ready for some middle ground. The everun foam is a nice transition. 4MM heel to toe is not real noticeable. They feel good.
customer_reviews.author: J Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but tight...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable but I found them to be undersized compared to other running shoes I own. A 9-1/2 or 10 Medium width usually fits my feet perfectly but the 10D Men's size I ordered in the Saucony shoe is tight in length as well as across the top of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: gtaylormba

customer_reviews.title: Saucony makes a good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe so far and I have been happy with the purchase. The shoes feel very light when running but I still feel good cushion on impact. I like the comfort also. When I first put them on they felt a little snug but after a week of training they are very comfortable. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Light,comfortable, and like running on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to move to from the brooks ghost shoes. This shoe does a great job of filling my need. It is light, comfortable, and delivers the cushioning I need while I'm still a tad overweight and training to lose the weight
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy!
customer_reviews.text: So far no complaints except that my knee hurt the first run. I think I got too used to running in flats. Anyway, these are very comfy so I'm gonna definitely see if I get used to them for my long runs.
customer_reviews.author: nursezlerf

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Long time kinvara fan. Have logged thousands of miles since they first came out. The 7 in my opinion fits more like the 5 and the 3. I was not a fan of the 4 or 6. The ever run foam is a nice touch. Not too bouncy and you still get that minimal feel. The colors are a bit wild for me but I took them out through the mud and that helped. If you are a kinvara fan, these shoes do not disappoint. The only thing they hurt is your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fischer

customer_reviews.title: They are very light but still offer good support. The shoes breakdown faster than some other ...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my fifth or sixth pair of these shoes or its predecessor. The shoe has a minimal rise which is why I purchase them. They are very light but still offer good support. The shoes breakdown faster than some other brands that I have worn in the past. I figure somewhere between 250 and 300 miles I need to replace this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: chaucersdog

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes ever. The 7 returns to its more minimalist roots. They can be a tad tight in the bridge area,but will loosen with use. I tried other shoes recently, but had to return to the Kinvara!
customer_reviews.author: william sites

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and lightweight. Really great running shoe, but the bottom sole materials seem like they will wear very quickly, so they may not last long.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew White

customer_reviews.title: Kinvara series 7
customer_reviews.text: These are the best Saucony Kinvara series shoes that I have bought so far, the fit is better. very lightweight. I plan on buying another pair because of this fact.
customer_reviews.author: smokey

customer_reviews.title: NIce.
customer_reviews.text: I run about 7 miles a day. These are my go to shoe right now. A have used a few pairs. Get just above 500 miles before they start failing somewhere. NIce.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great kicks!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I am a big Saucony fan anyway but these Kinvara 7 are the most comfortable I've had. True to size and great for running and for everyday wear. Totally recommend them to others and will purchase again myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Best Kinvara yet!
customer_reviews.text: Great new addition to the Kinvara line. A little more structure and cushion, but still very natural mid-foot running with a nice, roomy toe box and snug heel. Like the black soles and less wild color, too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matheny

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes them. There extremely light and perfect for running. The only thing he wish it had was alittle more Cushing in the sole. Other than that he said they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: The go to shoe for fast runs
customer_reviews.text: I started out with Kinvara 3's. Love this line. Great for fast runs. Comfortable for such a light shoe. The 7's have improvements that make it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Robhart

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love running in these shoes. They fit as expected and I love all of the color options. I bought a second pair right away and will break them out once my first pair wear out.
customer_reviews.author: William W Boyd III

customer_reviews.title: I love the color
customer_reviews.text: I love the color, design and the superior quality of these running shoes. My son wears them every day to school, the gym and outing. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ching Hsiao

customer_reviews.title: I really like the lightness and small drop (heel to toe) of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to start transitioning from a very bulky motion control shoe (Brooks Beast 14) to a more neutral running shoe. I had issues with plantar fasciitis and the Brooks Beast, along with some superfeet arch inserts, really helped me get through a rough patch. Now I have been working on mobility in my feet and ankles, as well as improving my posture and stance to rebuild my arches. I have been running in these Kinvara's for about 6 months and I am still pain free in the feet. I really like the lightness and small drop (heel to toe) of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: cramblda

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, great running shoe. My only negative is that they didn't hold up that long
customer_reviews.author: John Neusch

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my sixth pair of Saucony Kinvara running shoes. After running on these for about a month they seem as great as the last five pair.
customer_reviews.author: flatsfisher

customer_reviews.title: it's great! But damn I miss the kinvara 5 😥😥😥
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, it's great! But damn I miss the kinvara 5 😥😥😥
customer_reviews.author: MarkAustin

customer_reviews.title: not as comfortable as previous Kinvaras
customer_reviews.text: Very stiff, not as comfortable as previous Kinvaras. Also felt pains in my arch during and post run
customer_reviews.author: Civilt

customer_reviews.title: Happy runner
customer_reviews.text: These are my 3rd pair of Kinvaras (2nd of the model 7) and I wear them for all of my long runs. Outstanding shoes. Great transaction would use the seller again - no issues at all
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: I love Saucony
customer_reviews.text: I just love the Saucony product. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Colon

customer_reviews.title: Order larger size
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run small a half size. They are snug but I like them and will use them without socks
customer_reviews.author: Roger Nance

customer_reviews.title: Kinvara 7 good for short and long distance training
customer_reviews.text: very light shoe, good bounce and comfortable. i have put about 100 miles on it and it seems to be holding up well. got a good deal on it now that the Kinvara 8 is out. i wear a 12 in Men's
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Great for training and race day
customer_reviews.text: Consistent fit and sizing. Very comfortable and responsive. Lightweight. Kinvara has always been my favorite--black/olive looks great!
customer_reviews.author: trailrunner

customer_reviews.title: I felt better with the slightly wider soles
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well. I felt that Kinvara 7 shoes have slightly wider sole compared to Kinvara 6; I felt better with the slightly wider soles.
customer_reviews.author: swagho

customer_reviews.title: Quality Seller
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, high quality product. Unable to give 5 stars on the shoe itself...Simply since I have yet to run in them more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect piece of gear for the grind
customer_reviews.text: Perfect piece of gear for the grind. These got me though a couple of schools (earlier models) I went away from them and don't know why. Buying these made me feel like a got a part of myself back from the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do it.
customer_reviews.text: *About a month since purchase* These shoes are a big step up from the Kinvara 6. I loved them, but my 6's never really fit my feet right. Haven't had that issue at all with my 7's. I run around 10-20 miles a week and I find these to be some of the most comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I might even buy a second pair just for good measure.
customer_reviews.author: V. Glenn-Stone

customer_reviews.title: I have the Kinvara 5 and absolutely love them. As the mileage was getting high on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the Kinvara 5 and absolutely love them. As the mileage was getting high on those, I purchased the 7's. They feel just slightly heavier than the 5's, but overall, very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: THeil

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little narrow and small, but a great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of Saucony Kinvara Running Shoes. The last pair did a ton of road running, gym work and kicking around, and they held up very well. When I bought the other pair, it was because they were recommended for folks with wider feet. However, the 7 seems to step outside that. The shoe runs about a half size small, and a little on the narrow side. Altogether, it is still a great, lightweight, comfortable shoe that is ideal for the heel-strikers. One last note: I love the Slime Green/Black color on the pair I got.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Narrow shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have worn a size 10.5 M in previous Saucony shoes and ordered the same size in the Kinvara 7. The length felt OK but the shoe was far too narrow. I ordered a half size up to see if there was any improvement and once again, the shoe was too narrow. The shoes looked good and the construction was excellent but they simply did not fit my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Kinvara fan and have been for a long time. All my short runs are done in these shoes. Longer runs are done in hoka one ones. The Kinvara have a great fit and feel and are very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Saucony shoes you can get for street or hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Best Saucony shoes you can get for street or hard pack running. I love them. ( I do about 12-25 miles a week)
customer_reviews.author: 05allthetime

customer_reviews.title: I have always loved the Kinvara 4 and was really hesitant to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits as about as expected for the Kinvara line (a half size up from standard ). I have always loved the Kinvara 4 and was really hesitant to purchase these upon reading some reviews of the line. However, I love the 7 and would recommend the shoe. The lace system takes a moment to get used to, but no complaints. Just a simple, straight-forward shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley M Besednjak

customer_reviews.title: High ratings
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe: Light weight, flexible and cushioned. Similar to Kinvara 6 in most aspects.
customer_reviews.author: leonard hymes

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Running Shoes!!! Definitely an improvement over ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous Running Shoes !!! Definitely an improvement over Kinvara 6 !!!
customer_reviews.author: Gaom

customer_reviews.title: Saucony for life
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and just the right amount of cushioning for road races. Perfect fit that I expect from Saucony. Lace system secures for a custom fit. 4mm offset and light weight make this shoe my go to hard training and racing shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V

customer_reviews.title: I love saucony shoes and these did not let me down
customer_reviews.text: I love saucony shoes and these did not let me down. They are comfortable for classes at the gym and for running. I also love the color.
customer_reviews.author: Bradleyann Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe, fit great. Wish I could buy the same model in all black.
customer_reviews.author: Amrita

customer_reviews.title: Like wearing air
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet so the narrowness is to be expected. Super comfortable and VERY light. Barely know they are on my feet after hours of wear. Great support, good cushion but not too much.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Kozol

customer_reviews.title: but very comfortable so far
customer_reviews.text: Only been them for a couple of weeks, but very comfortable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie P

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and smooth running
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and smooth running. Wish the heel was a little narrower but other than that a good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: KingLeighr

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good running shoe, not overly impressed with the cushion and comfort underneath, they'll do, tongue of shoe is very comfortable oddly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: My new "go-to" kicks.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy all day kicks with a catchy appearance. Lifelong swoosh guy, but these are more comfortable than anything I've owned by Uncle Phil.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the Kinvara 6 model, the Kinvara 7 runs a little tight in the toebox. Love the shoes overall.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: These shoes help with my arch burnout and are amazing! I have one pair for everyday use and a pair just for working out. Highly recommend. I am a woman, but wear these!
customer_reviews.author: Cristyn Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Marathoner and Streak Runner
customer_reviews.text: I'm a marathoner and Streak runner. These will be my 6th pair used this year and my Marathon shoe when I put them in the rotation in October. The fit is true, the heal/toe stack and weight make this a great training and race day shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeling Run.
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes, however the fit is just a bit snug I will be getting another pair I'll just get a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of the 7 model. Very good shoes, with excellent cushion and support.
customer_reviews.author: Gopher Puck Guy

customer_reviews.title: The 6 was great. The 7 seems better so far
customer_reviews.text: For the past 5 yrs have only run in Kinvara. Each model is an improvement. The 6 was great. The 7 seems better so far.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Calaluce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best running shoes.Very light weight and looks good.The best part is that it's under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Truong

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our son who has to be kind of choosy when picking out shoes. He loves these! They have the arch support and cushion he needs. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe. I've tried other Saucony's but I'm back ...
customer_reviews.text: A great shoe. I've tried other Saucony's but I'm back to the Kinvara.
customer_reviews.author: Clark B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kinvaras are the best. I cannot get K5s anywhere, so trying the 7. Fit good.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian D.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe, well built and really light weight. Smooth, well-cushioned ride.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS C JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: They provide good support and I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.text: These are used as marathon trainers. They provide good support and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a very good, lightweight and sturdy shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: They are ok for me.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Asics and Saucony...Both brands have a level of consistency that enables me to order running shoes online, and know that it will fit. These shoes are no exception. The fit is consistent with what I have come to expect from Saucony. As far as this particular model...I have long wanted to try the kinvara shoe. The typically look sharp, and are extremely light. But for me, the arch/support just wasn't "right" for me...I typically go for minimal type shoes and still manage to get a little bit better feeling arch. They are still good comfy, light weight shoes...but probably will not ear the position in my race arsenal
customer_reviews.author: runlevel6

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for the better part of a day to ensure they fit well, and then ran my long run (17 miles) the next day. They fit perfectly and I never thought about them again throughout my run. They performed wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Great compromise option as it is lighter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a more supportive version of a minimalist shoe, due to no longer being able to wear minimalist shoes. Great compromise option as it is lighter, despite appearing bulkier. Since it is a compromise it's not my ideal shoe, hence a 4/5, but that's personal bias from someone who normally exercises in minimalist shoes. I preferred how the Nike Pegasus felt wearing it (being a fan of the Nike Frees), but ultimately this was the lightest shoe I could find with this level of support, so my knees thank me without sacrificing too much mobility.
customer_reviews.author: texm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, stable, and lightweight with plenty of room in the toe box. Much improved over the Kinvara 6, which I tried and immediately returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Awesome shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. Light weight, super support. My first pair of Saucony's but won't be my last. I will try and wear them out this summer.
customer_reviews.author: scott tripp

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very light shoes, for light runners! Be ware to choose a half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I continue to purchase these shoes because these are the shoes I run races in
customer_reviews.author: Brion M. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have two other pairs so I am going to order a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so great! Only a few miles so far, but they feel very good whilst running.
customer_reviews.author: William Bayse

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Kinvaras so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several Kinvaras in the past and I've like them all but I think these are my favorite so far. Hope they hold up well as the uppers in the previous versions I've bought got holes in them after about a year of use. I've heard people complain about the toe box and the relatively new lacing system but I have plenty of room in the toe box and the lacing system doesn't bother me. Saucony if you read this id love a pair of Kinvaras with a non-white sole. Perhaps grey upper with a red sole ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nickles

customer_reviews.title: great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got my new kinvara 7, excellent fit and very light, feels wider than the kinvara 6 and that is good! Cant wait to put some miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: jose rendon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very cushy ride. Fit is snug but not quite a 1/2 size under. Worthy of their stellar reputation
customer_reviews.author: Bigstein

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable! The toe box was a little small
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! The toe box was a little small, but here are tabs in the middle of the laces that allows them to be looser at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Scherer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excelent fit! I had kinvara 6, and this model is better that I expected. It feel so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe! Read several reviews and decided to give ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe! Read several reviews and decided to give them a try- my go to running shoe from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Havent had them very long but so far I love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if you have low arches like myself, it does not offer great support
customer_reviews.text: Very light shoe with a decent look to it. However, if you have low arches like myself, it does not offer great support. I put in a number of 15-20+ mile runs in this shoe, but usually ended up blistered afterwards due to the top of the shoe being very narrow, and didn't offer much room for my feet to breathe. Overall decent shoe. They were okay to use for a few months but I would not purchase another pair.
customer_reviews.author: bill

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Running Shoes Blue blue 8.5, Blue, 8 UK
product_meta.description: SAUCONY KINVARA 7 RUNPOPS BLUE S203361 Get now your limited edition trainers at the best price assured. The Saucony Kinvara 7 Runpops running trainers are perfect of runners with neutral stride who are looking for comfort and quality.
